title: Body of England fan Rob Spray is returned to England - but family still awaiting answers behind his death in police custody
text:
The body of the football supporter who died in Bulgaria has finally been returned to England, but the family of Rob Spray still face a frustrating wait as they attempt to get answers over the circumstances behind his death.

Mr Spray’s body was flown back into Heathrow Airport on Thursday, along with paperwork that will be studied by a coroner ahead of an autopsy to try to determine how he died in police custody before England’s Euro 2020 qualifying game against Bulgaria in Sofia.

The cause of death on the death certificate the family have received has so far been left blank and Mr Spray’s family will intensify their attempt to force an independent inquiry into what happened when they meet the MP for Cannock Chase Amanda Milling on Friday.

The friend of Mr Spray, Roger Wootton, who set up an online petition to demand a full investigation that has now surpassed 12,000 signatures is also trying to push for a government response.

But it has emerged that Mr Spray’s family could have been incorrectly told they should expect the results of a toxicology report to arrive swiftly. Bulgarian authorities originally estimated the findings of a report would be released last Friday, but coroners have told Telegraph Sport it could take another six weeks for a toxicology report to be completed.
description: The body of the football supporter who died in Bulgaria has finally been returned to England, but the family of Rob Spray still face a frustrating wait as they attempt to get answers over the circumstances behind his death.
